intro: Fontenellea brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian flame vine, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is not commonly found outside of its native range.
